body_html:
2 days ago, virtualenv option install of tensorflow (tf) on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, CUDNNv6, when import tensorflow, gave error ImportError: libcudnn.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory so it was still looking for CUDNN v5, but when I

pip install --upgrade tensorflow

(do that with tensorflow-gpu as well)
then it now works with CUDNNv6 successfully. So be sure to pip install --upgrade ... (i.e. update pip) and make sure to have that latest 1.2.1 version of tf, with the pip or virtualenv pip install option.

body:
2 days ago, virtualenv option install of tensorflow (tf) on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, CUDNNv6, when import tensorflow, gave error ImportError: libcudnn.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory so it was still looking for CUDNN v5, but when I   

```  
pip install --upgrade tensorflow
``` 
(do that with tensorflow-gpu as well) 
then it now works with CUDNNv6 successfully.  So be sure to pip install --upgrade ... (i.e. update pip) and make sure to have that latest 1.2.1 version of tf, with the pip or virtualenv pip install option.
